alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Corson; Edmunds; Faulk; McPherson; Walworth (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 3:17AM MST until February 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. Blizzard conditions possible. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central South Dakota. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through early Tuesday evening. A second period from Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible Tuesday night through early Thursday morning. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes this week. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The first round of snow could occur on Tuesday, with 3 to 5 inches of snow possible. After a break in significant falling snow Tuesday night, a second round of snow could occur from Wednesday morning through Thursday morning, with 7 to 11 inches of snow possible. Blizzard conditions could be possible from Tuesday night through early Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Campbell; Corson; Edmunds; Faulk; McPherson; Walworth
